intro: Centaurea zeybekii, commonly known as the Turkish knapweed, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, spiky bracts around its flower heads. Centaurea zeybekii is often found in open areas such as hillsides and grasslands.
